Grateful to have the opportunity to participate in today’s dedication ceremony honoring the 129 men lost aboard the USS Thresher when the submarine tragically sank off the coast of Cape Cod on April 10, 1963. Watch the ceremony live on my Facebook page:  https://facebook.com/SenatorShaheen/
The USS Thresher Memorial is an opportunity for our country to honor the life, service and sacrifice of Franklin James Palmer and his fellow crewmates.

Leadingman Machinist Franklin James Palmer was a Durham native who worked at the Portsmouth Naval Shipyard as a machinist operator. Following his WWII service, he would return to the Shipyard. He loved to build & race stock cars & would go on to earn an airplane pilot's license. pic.twitter.com/HD0iZ1xUca
